message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String[] args) {
    String split_vls = "11. Welcome1. to java programming |1. Oops concepts |12. Encapsulation |3.Abstraction  |14.Inheritance  |5.Polymorphism";
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(split_vls, "|");
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String token = st.nextToken().replaceAll("\\d+\\.", "");
        System.out.println(token.trim());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the StringTokenizer class to split the string using the pipe symbol '|' as the delimiter. We then iterate through the tokens using the hasMoreTokens() method and remove the numeric bullet numbers using the replaceAll() method. Finally, we trim the resulting token and print it. This will give us the expected output: Welcome to java programming, Oops concepts, Encapsulation, Abstraction, Inheritance, Polymorphism.
